text: It's those leaders whom I've modeled myself after. I thank them for their service, and I hope there will be more to come for generations.
A great president cannot be a puppet, and can't be a machine. They have to be someone who really cares.
They owed it to the voters of this country and their children to be honest and transparent with their beliefs and their actions.
There are many qualities the greatest presidents have shared, but one that stands out most is that they all put the people first.
Today, we honor the citizens who have taken the most sacred of oaths, and agreed to lead our nation, through good times and bad.

Our body, our choice. Happy 40th, Roe v. Wade!
We owe it to our grandmothers, mothers, daughters, and granddaughters to make sure the future is one where women won't have to fight anymore
Many still seek to take the rights of women away, but we will stand up for equality, and we will stand up for our bodies.
It has been 40 years of debating, 40 years of fighting, and 40 years of protecting our rights as women to make our own medical decisions.
From the bottom of my heart, thank you all for your support!
I couldn't have gotten to this point without your help. It was hard work to get here, and we'll need to keep it up to make it to Washington.

(2/2) which provides coverage for nearly 8 mil kids in families w/ incomes too high for Medicaid, but not enough to afford private insurance
It allows young people to stay on their parents' insurance until they're 26, and grants new funding for CHIP (1/2)
No longer will existing health conditions or income stand in the way of you receiving the healthcare you deserve.
I was very proud to help pass the act when I was in Congress. The law will provide coverage for 32 million previously uncovered Americans.
One of the many reasons I'm looking forward to 2013 is the rollout of the Affordable Care Act.

Warm wishes to all of you on Christmas Eve!
Although our children and grandchildren (and some of us big kids) wish we could have snow for the holiday, it's still a beautiful holiday.
So if you can, please take a moment to help others by donating to a local soup kitchen, food pantry, or other charity that feeds the hungry.
According the Greater Chicago Food Depository, 1 in 6 of our neighbors is unsure where they will find their next meal.
While we celebrate the holiday season with family and friends, please remember that hunger is a terrible problem in our communities.
Take the time to be grateful for what we have, and remember those we've lost. May the joy and unity of the season carry through 2013.
But that means we must be all the more grateful. Thanks to their courage and hard work, we're able to enjoy the holidays in peace.
I want to take a moment to thank all of our troops serving overseas during the holiday season. Our troops sacrifice for us.
